Pre-Game Insights: Greece will face Finland at the Georgios Karaiskakis on Saturday in the opening game of their 2024-25 UEFA Nations League campaign.
Greece missed out on a spot in the European Championship after losing on penalties to Georgia in the playoffs final, prompting the exit of head coach Gus Poyet after two years at the helm.
Greece performed well in the Nations League back in 2022, picking up five wins from their six games and finishing atop their group as they secured promotion to League B.
Greece will be looking to pick up where they left off in the tournament this week as they target a positive start to life under new boss Ivan Jovanovic.
Finland participated in the European Championship playoffs but were knocked out in the semifinals by Wales.

Finland engaged in friendly action in their subsequent outings, most recently playing out a 2-2 draw against Scotland, with Benjamin Kallman and Oliver Antman netting second-half goals to secure a draw for Huuhkajat.
Miscellaneous Highlights: There have been 18 meetings between Greece and Finland. The hosts have won half of those games while the visitors have won six times. There have been three draws between the two teams.
The two teams last faced off in an European Championship qualifying clash back in November 2019 which the hosts won 2-1.
Greece have won two of their last three games in this fixture after winning just one of their previous five.
Finland are without a clean sheet in their last five games across all competitions.
Greece were ranked 54th in the latest FIFA rankings and now sit nine places above their weekend opponents.
